page.title: 12Colburn Village.
page.content: Going north down{Colburn Lane}is a council housing estate.Only a small number have bought their houses from {Richmondshire}District Council.Below this estate are eight individually designed stone bungalows.Colburn village has twenty two houses ,three being farms,and a{population}of forty five.Running through the village is a beck .The owner of the sixteenth century hall also owns the village pub.The houses facing the beck are very old cottages that have been modernised .More recent houses blend in with the old.Running by the hall is a public footpath which leads to the {River Swale}by the side of{Christie } {Wood}.The village is a settled community and houses for sale are rare.It is usually people from outside Colburn who buy and come to live in the village. (E.Carter)
